reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at roughly 1pm, we opted for a first choice package when booking. We were told by the first choice leader on the bus that check in wasn't until 2pm Got to the hotel, to check in- and were told that our room wasnt ready until 2.45. We werent too happy with this, as our luggage was nowhere to be seen either as first choice had shipped it in another bus. We waited around for our luggage for about an hour, to change and pop into get some lunch and it was only when we asked that they told us our luggage was already there, and had been taken to our room. Some families checking in were told they had to wait until 5pm for their room, so we were fortunate in a way. If First choice, or the hotel would have explained to us this procedure our holiday would have gone to a much better start. That was our biggest fault with the hotel on a whole. The rooms were brilliant, and breakfast was great. We didnt use the restaurant and bar, as we opted to go into funchal instead. You did feel however that the hotel was a little confused as to what its function was. It was large, and most of it unused. We played table tennis, and used the gym and pool-these were all good facilities. I was baffled that the hotel charged 15Euros to use the tennis court-something i refused to do in a 5* hotel, this should be included. As a whole it is a good hotel, some aspects 5* but not all, more of a 4*. It sits in a good location to funchal.
reviews.title: a confused 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel is situated just on the tip of the town centre on a hill-not too steep.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is huge and looks impressive upon arrival, but of Vegas feel to it.
reviews.title: 5 STAR HOTEL??? 2 STAR SERVICE!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Corridors are big, dimly lit and bit eery..distant music playing adds to the spooky feel!
reviews.title: perfect holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms on the back of the hotel have to endure lots of noise such as a generator noises ? Building work, ship's unloading and loading ....you still have a sea view but what's the point when it's not a quiet sea view?
reviews.title: Shame about the outside!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from this hotel in September 2011. Central hotel with a good standard of accommodation.Probably 4 *. Excellent restaurants and Food. Mozart restaurant is worth a try. Nicely situated hotel overlooking the sea and handy for the city. Maderia is a beautiful place, clean, pleasant gardens and nice people. Not a huge amount for kids but they enjoyed hotel, pool and spa. Tennis area and childrens area needs attention. However all in all 10 out of 10 for holiday.
reviews.title: Definitely worth a stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I have just returned from our first visit to Maderia, we stayed in this lovely Hotel, our room was on the 8th floor where we had lovely views, the staff were very nice, breakfast was Buffet with a lot of choice, our only negatives is there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room and the food in the restaurant at night is buffet and not very nice we eat there on 2 occasions and felt it is overpriced for what you get...there are some really nice restaurants very close to the Hotel when you leave the Hotel go left and down the lane and they are all reasonably priced....the bar was nice and staff friendly...The Hotel is at the top of a hill which is great going into Funchal but a bit of a trek coming back...Word of caution there was 1 night we were invited to drink's in the reception this leads to a talk from one of the reps for Pestana where she invited us to see another one of their hotels in case we wanted to return to Maderia, but this turned out to be very like Time Share and we declined....
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On approaching the hotel from a distance quite shocked as it put me in mind of a block of flats in an old eastern bloc country. Thankfully when we arrived there it was nothing of the sort. Plenty of space to sit around if you didn't want to go out or sit in your room. Seating areas on each floor close to the lifts which were ideal when it got too hot. Room was spacious and very clean with a balcony giving great views over the ocean and the early morning views as Funchal awoke were wonderful. Staff are excellent, very friendly and professional, nothing is too much trouble. We are glad we chose to come here for our silver wedding anniversary. Although we would certainly stay here again we wouldn't eat here, we found the food not up to a standard expected of a 5 star hotel. Hotel is a shortl walk to the marina and not too far from the lido area. Amongst some of the trips we did was a catamaran trip to go whale watching, 4 sightings in all, absolutely brilliant. Penty to see and do. Funchal is certainly worth a visit. There are plenty of restaurants - 2 we definitely would recomment are Forte de Sao Tiago and Solar da Ajuda, both with excellent staff, food and service.
reviews.title: HOTEL REALLY GOOD, FOOD NOT SO GOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: For a 5 star hotel at the lower end of the budget, pestana Caslon park is a great hotel. Bed are comfortable, rooms are generously sizes, pool great, indoor pool and sauna/ jacuzzi amazing. The staff are very friendly are always available to give advice. Only problem I found was the breakfast meal wasn't that great, the bacon/sauages were not very tastey at all but good bacon out in maderia is very expensive, 6euros pack.Price wise it is quite expensive, portion of chips 4 euros in the hotel. Evening buffet dinner 27euro 29inculding drinks, beer 3euros for a pint of the local beer "Corel". Location wise close to Funchal centre 20 mins walk and 5 mins by taxi or bus, and similar distant to forum shopping centre out of town shopping centre. All in all great place to stay in maderia.
reviews.title: Really good, shame about the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel. A gem of modern architecture before its name became mud. Thanks to the inspired design of architect Oscar Niemeyer (of Brasilia fame) every room has a generous balcony and a great view, whether of the sea and cliffs or the magnificent amphitheatre of Funchal, which turns into a sparkling light show at night. Breakfast is in a wonderful light-filled double-height restaurant or you can sit outside overlooking the infinity pool. The staff were very helpful (but never intrusive). And the biggest plus is it's the closest major hotel to Funchal's centre and old town, making it easy to walk everywhere. Beware - some of the other big hotels are a real shlep in tropical temperatures!
reviews.title: Classic hotel, fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. The only negatives were the rooms needed a bit of updating & the sheets were not changed during the week & because it was so hot there they should have changed them. The breakfast was pretty much the same every day but saying that there was something for everyone & as it was a buffet you could eat as much as you wanted. We were on B&B so ate out every night & found some amazing restaurants. We went into Funchal but didn't enjoy the restaurants there as much as the ones found to the back of the hotel. there is a new Turkish restaurant under the Irish bar Moynahans which was our favourite it had only been opened a week & the food was fresh & plentiful. Also check out Mal Brandos' further up the road. All the restaurants up this road were busy so either go early or book. We didn't take any scheduled trips with coach company we opted for a taxi to take us around the north & east of the island for a fraction of the cost. We saw more & also the money went to a local & not tour operator. The taxi driver Carlos was born on the island so had great knowledge of the area.
reviews.title: Good location,clean & friendly though rooms could do with updating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had fabulous weather so spent a few days by the pool. The outside area of hotel is beautiful but a bit noisy with the dock down below. But it didn't spoil our relaxing! Try & book a room on top floor as the views are amazing especially first thing in the morning. There is a lot of building work going on around Funchal but like everywhere it's got to be done sometime. We like to holiday in different countries every year but would consider going back here. One last thing it is quite a hilly place (obviously) so take good walking shoes!
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday - suit mature traveller best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large bedrooms, helpful staff, very clean everywhere. Convenient location.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on bed and breakfast basis and found plenty of good places to eat close to hotel and in town centre.
reviews.title: A little bit of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good things: comfortable beds, gorgeous swimming pool, plenty of sun loungers, good coffee,
reviews.title: pretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not so good: cafeteria food, uneven service, expensive recycled food in Dockside restaurant, furniture on balcony bum numbing, feeling of being processed and having to adhere to their outdated rules.
reviews.title: Pestana Casino Park Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Do eat outside - wonderful and very reasonable food elsewhere. Excursions are very reasonable and get you away from hotel.
reviews.title: Great location for business meetings and casino access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great holiday there but please check before you go we had a conference there, we had 1600 delegates for a Forensic Scientist Conference guests were in a minority this was second week in September. The staff were very friendly hand helpful the rooms were clean and we had maid service everyday. The food was very good the Salad bar and Dessert was really good, the hot food was not so good being their two week the same meals were repeated every week with a slight variation on the theme. We were always down for the first sitting and some of the food was a bit dried up I had corn on the cob and I could not stick my fork into as it was so dried up and the Barbecued meats could be a little tough The wine in the evening was quite dear when I saw the same bottle in the supermarket for 10 euros less, that was quite a surprise, so if you get a free upgrade to half board expect to pay more for other things. The meals at the Dock Side bar lacked variation it was the same every day with a lack of choice on the menu. We asked ourselves would we go there again the answer is Yes, but we would ask more question about conferences., and please complain if you do not get the room you requested, like upper floor.
reviews.title: Great location with fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casino Park is a twenty minute drive from the airport. Upon arrival, you walk into a large open lobby with reception to your right and a very large bar and lounge further in. The hotel is neat, and the staff speak English very well.
reviews.title: Great but they will charge for everything and try to give you an unacceptable room unless you complain!
